categories.title: Recent ElizaOS Updates: UI Improvements and Bug Fixes

content.text:
# UI and Layout Enhancements

Several improvements have been made to the ElizaOS user interface:
- Enhanced memory viewer functionality (PR #4027)
- Improved profile UI and layout (PR #4021)
- Home page layout improvements with a new create button (PR #4013)
- Action viewer UI improvements (PR #4039)
- Grid size adjustments (PR #4015)

# Stack and Room Functionality Updates

The stack and room features received several updates:
- Added maxStack functionality back (PR #4014)
- Stack improvements (PR #4010)
- Fixed room stack issues (PR #4011)

# Bug Fixes

Several bugs were addressed in recent updates:
- Fixed CLI agent command (PR #4028)
- Resolved profile overflow issue (PR #4025)
- Fixed OpenAI speech-to-text functionality (PR #4017)
- Fixed profile picture display for group chats (PR #4008)
- Addressed UX issues with start and create functions (PR #4007)

# Group Chat Enhancements

Group chat functionality has been improved:
- Updated agents status in group (PR #4012)
- Fixed profile picture issues for group chats (PR #4008)

# Documentation and Testing

Documentation and test coverage have been updated:
- Updated README.md (PR #4006)
- Updated intro.md documentation (PR #4005)
- Improved plugin storage S3 test coverage (PR #3976)

## ElizaOS Technical Discussions

The ElizaOS Discord channels have featured extensive technical discussions on various aspects of the platform:

### Development and Documentation
- **ElizaOS Beta Installation**: A step-by-step guide was provided for installing the beta version using `npm create eliza@beta`
- **Knowledge Management**: Discussions about how Eliza retrieves knowledge, with recommendations to split large documents into smaller markdown files for efficiency
- **LLMs.txt for Documentation**: Proposal to use an `LLMs.txt` file as a distilled version of documentation for AI-assisted querying
- **Entity-Component System Visualization**: Technical visualization of entities (User, Agent, Composite Entity) and components (Profile, Permissions, Data)

### Technical Features and Components
- **Evaluators in AgentRuntime**: These extract and assess conversation data for agent learning, enabling reflection and behavioral adaptation
- **Providers in ElizaOS**: Sources of real-time data for agents (news, terminal, wallet, time providers)
- **Knowledge Upload API**: Successfully implemented for uploading markdown documents to an agent's knowledge base
- **PDF Knowledge Ingestion**: Discussion about using `Folder2knowledge` and `knowledge2character` to process PDFs into character knowledge

### Issues and Troubleshooting
- **Gitpod Setup Issue**: Users encountered blocked request errors due to missing `server.allowedHosts` in `vite.config.js`
- **Twitter Plugin Integration**: Discussions about creating endpoints to reply to tweets and fixing issues with Twitter posting
- **Action Recognition Bug**: Issues where plugin actions weren't being recognized, with advice to enable debug logs and ensure proper registration

## Spartan V2 Development and Communication

### Development Status
- **Spartan V2 Launch Coordination**: Work is ongoing to enable Spartan chat before the official V2 launch, with the beta phase expected to last about two weeks
- **Token Utility & AI Integration**: Discussions about AI16z utility formation and potential DegenAI utility, with current focus on open-source functionality and Spartan V2 deployment

### Communication Strategies
- **Public Communication & Access**: Suggestions to make channels public again or create new Discord/X accounts for project updates
- **X (Twitter) Account Strategy**: Proposal to create a new X account announcing "Spartan coming soon v2" with the contract address in the bio
- **Testing Channel Proposal**: Suggestion to create a closed Discord channel for testing before public release
- **Automated vs. Manual Posts**: Recommendation to attach visually appealing template images to dev update announcements on X

### Technical Updates
- **Telegram Buy Bot Update**: Plans to modify the buy bot to only post transactions over $2K to reduce noise
- **Channel Access**: The Discord channel was made private to provide holders exclusive access to Spartan V2 with sentiment analysis

## Tokenomics and AI Agent Collaboration

### Tokenomics Discussions
- **Tokenomics Issues**: Concerns raised about ElizaOS tokenomics, specifically that launchpads are using it without real integration or utility
- **Open-Core Model & Staking**: Suggestions for an open-core model with a paid enterprise version to fund Eliza Labs, and discussions about staking mechanisms
- **Bonding Curve Incentives**: Concept of applying bonding curves to AI Take Over coin, allowing early adopters to gain larger stakes

### AI Agent Collaboration Framework
- **AI Agent Collaboration**: Proposal for ElizaOS instances to contract agents from each other using a registry and reputation system
- **Liquidity Extraction Strategy**: Proposal to use AI swarms to revive abandoned meme coins, attract liquidity, and redirect funds into new projects
- **Pump.fun Coin Recycling**: Discussion on repurposing dead pump.fun coins into new projects by reskinning the main launchpad

### Partnership Discussions
- **Partnership with ChainGPT**: Proposal for marketing, funding, and co-launch opportunities, with mixed reception from the team
- **ElizaOS AI-NFT Token Feature**: Announcement of an agent token feature enabling AI-NFT agents to issue and trade tokens via a pump.fun-based launchpad

## Image Generation and Design

### Image Generation Tools and Techniques
- **Stable Diffusion vs. MidJourney**: Preference for Stable Diffusion due to greater control
- **Flux Model**: Used for sentence-based image generation
- **Workflow**: Claude/Grok used for prompt generation, then fed into Stable Diffusion/Flux
- **Optimization**: Adding "masterpiece, best quality" to prompts improves results

### Design Concepts
- **Software Box Art Concept**: Digital collectibles (NFTs) for software projects, inspired by Vocaloid box art
- **Entity-Component System Visualization**: Visual representation of the modular architecture in ElizaOS
- **Providers Visualization**: Concept of an anime girl on a digital bridge connecting to floating data sources

## Cryptocurrency Discussions

Some channels primarily focused on cryptocurrency price updates, token discussions, and general market sentiment without significant technical content. These discussions included:

- Price movements and trading activity
- Market speculation
- Token utility discussions

These channels did not contain substantial technical discussions, problem-solving, or concrete implementations related to ElizaOS development.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several significant pull requests have been made to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on UI improvements, feature additions, and bug fixes:

- Documentation updates with visual improvements and core cleanup (PR #4032)
- Addition of partial agent update functionality (PR #4026)
- Bug fixes for CLI character parameter and plugin-solana issues (PR #4016)
- UI enhancements including a new create button and home page layout improvements (PR #4013)
- Action viewer UI improvements (PR #4039)
- Added drag & drop functionality for environment file uploading (PR #4033)

New plugins and integrations have also been introduced:

- Redpill support (PR #4045)
- Groq integration (PR #4044)
- DPSN Plugin (PR #4043)

The crypto market shows fluctuations in prices for two tracked cryptocurrencies. WBTC has seen a decrease from $86,666.89 to $84,046.87, representing a drop of approximately 3%. Similarly, ai16z has declined from $0.19104 to $0.18514, a decrease of about 3.1%. These price movements indicate a slight downward trend in the current crypto market for these assets.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository:

1. Issue #4037: A user named NewtTheWolf reported being unable to find the package '@elizaos/plugin-openai' when using beta packages.

2. Issue #4034: User imduchuyyy has created an issue regarding a Golang port for the project.

3. Issue #4042: User jmikedupont2 reported an error with UUID syntax, specifically "invalid input syntax for type uuid: \"-1002129157442\"".

4. Issue #4040: Another issue from jmikedupont2 regarding Groq tokens per minute (TPM) with a limit of 6000.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From March 20-21, 2025, there were 22 new pull requests with 16 of them merged, along with 5 new issues and 19 active contributors. Activity decreased slightly the following day (March 21-22, 2025) with 9 new pull requests (only 1 merged), 4 new issues, and 14 active contributors.
sources: From 2025-03-20 to 2025-03-21, elizaos/eliza had 22 new PRs (16 merged), 5 new issues, and 19 active contributors.
From 2025-03-21 to 2025-03-22, elizaos/eliza had 9 new PRs (1 merged), 4 new issues, and 14 active contributors.

content.text: The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.

Development focused on package improvements, including fixing an error in plugin-tee. The work included 3 bug fixes, with 6 contributors merging 5 pull requests. Various other improvements were also made during this period.
